content:
Updating your LinkedIn profile is a great way to ensure your professional network is aware of your name change. Here's a step-by-step guide to help you update your last name on LinkedIn:

**LinkedIn:**

1. Log in to your LinkedIn account on a computer or mobile device.
2. Click on your profile picture in the top-right corner of the LinkedIn homepage.
3. Click on "View profile" from the dropdown menu.
4. Click on the "Edit public profile & URL" button on the right-hand side of your profile page.
5. Scroll down to the "Name" section.
6. Click on the pencil icon next to your current last name.
7. Enter your new last name (Thompson) in the "Last name" field.
8. Click "Save" to update your profile.

**Additional Tips:**

* Make sure you're logged in to the correct account on LinkedIn before making the changes.
* If you have a custom LinkedIn URL (e.g., linkedin.com/in/yourusername), you can update it separately from your display name. To do so, click on "Edit public profile & URL" and then click on the pencil icon next to your custom URL.
* You may want to consider updating your LinkedIn headline and summary to reflect your new last name, especially if they contain your previous last name.
* If you're connected with colleagues, clients, or friends on LinkedIn, you may want to consider sending them a brief message or posting an update to let them know about your name change.

That's it! Your LinkedIn profile should now reflect your new last name, Thompson.

Remember to update your other social media profiles and online accounts to ensure consistency across all your online presence.
